newsitem.title: CHINA: Authur Andersen China income to hit $100 mln in 97.
newsitem.headline: Authur Andersen China income to hit $100 mln in 97.

text.p: Arthur Andersen's revenue from its business in China is expected to hit $100 million in 1997, up 34 percent from last year, the Xinhua news agency said on Thursday.
China's rapidly evolving financial sector meant the demands for the accounting giant's services would grow dramatically, Xinhua quoted John Burrows, the firm's area managing partner, as saying.
"There is almost no limit to the opportunities for the accounting profession in China," the agency quoted Burrows as saying.
Arthur Andersen planned to double its current business in China by the end of the century, Burrows said but gave no further details.

The company had so far assisted 39 Chinese firms with overseas stock listings and bond issues worth $5 billion, and provided accounting and consulting services to more than 50 power plants in China, Xinhua said.
